system:
Cubdari is a traditional Georgian dish that is typically served during the winter months. It is a hearty stew that is made with beef, lamb, or pork and a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and beans. The stew is cooked in a rich broth made with tomato paste, wine, and spices.

Here's a recipe for Cubdari:

Cubdari (Georgian Beef Stew)
Ingredients:
• 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into cubes
• 2 cups onion, diced
• 1 cup celery, diced
• 1 cup carrots, diced
• 1 cup potatoes, diced
• 2 cups beef broth
• 1 can tomato paste
• 1 cup red wine
• Salt and pepper to taste
• 1 cup sour cream or yogurt (optional)
Instructions:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, saute the onion, celery, and carrots in oil until softened. Add the beef cubes and brown them on all sides.
2. Pour in the beef broth and bring to a boil. Add the tomato paste, wine, salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 30 minutes.
3. Add the potatoes and cook for another 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender. If desired, you can add sour cream or yogurt to make it more creamy.
4. Serve hot with fresh bread or rice. Enjoy!

prompt: ### Human: Ég hef lesið bókina "The Twelve Caesars" eftir Suetonius nokkrum sinnum. Ég er forvitinn um samhengið þegar hann skrifaði.### Assistant:
system:
The 12 Caesars was written by the Roman historian Suetonius around the year 121. Suetonius was a member of the equestrian class, which meant he held a higher rank than other commoners but was still below the senatorial class. As a result, Suetonius had access to a wide range of sources and was able to provide a more detailed and comprehensive account of the lives of the Roman emperors than any other historian before him.

One of the most significant themes in The 12 Caesars is the constant struggle for power and authority within the Roman Empire. Suetonius portrays the emperors as both ruthless and charismatic leaders who used their power to further their own ambitions and consolidate their positions of power. This struggle for power and authority is evident in many of the events described in The 12 Caesars, such as assassinations, coups, and civil wars.

Another key theme in The 12 Caesars is the relationship between the emperors and the Roman Senate. Suetonius often portrays the emperors as seeking to undermine the authority of the Senate and gain more control over the government. At the same time, he also highlights how some emperors were able to win over the support of the Senate through their charisma and political skills.

In 1928, Walt Disney produced his first full-length animated film "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs." The film was a huge success and became one of the most famous animated films in history. It also helped establish Walt Disney as a leading figure in the animation industry.

Over the next few decades, Walt Disney continued to produce some of the most beloved films in history such as "Pinocchio," "Fantasia," "Dumbo," "Bambi," "Cinderella," "Peter Pan," "Lady and the Tramp," "The Jungle Book," "The Aristocats," "The Little Mermaid," "Beauty and the Beast," "Aladdin," and many more. Walt Disney's legacy lives on today through his work at The Walt Disney Company, which continues to produce some of the most popular movies, theme parks, resorts, and entertainment experiences in the world.

- 1 lb. ground beef (or 100% grass-fed ground beef)
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup tomato paste
- 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, drained
- 1 can (4 oz) tomato sauce
- 2 cans (4 oz) stewed tomatoes, drained
- 3/4 cup red wine vinegar
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste

Directions:

4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish or an ovenproof skillet. Bake at 350 degrees F for about an hour or until the meat is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly. Let the casserole sit for about 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

Directions:

* 1 cup finely chopped cooked taro root
* 2 eggs, beaten
* 1/4 cup milk
* 2 tablespoons grated coconut

Directions:

Title: Comparison of Female Film Directors and Male Directors

Abstract: This paper examines the representation of female film directors and male directors in Hollywood films from 2014 to 2018. It looks at the number of female and male directors working in the film industry and the gender pay gap in Hollywood. The paper also explores the barriers faced by female directors in getting their films made and their struggles to be taken seriously in a male-dominated industry. The paper concludes that while there has been an increase in the number of female film directors, there is still a long way to go before gender parity is achieved.

Introduction: Hollywood has long been dominated by male film directors, with women only making up a small percentage of those working in the industry. While there have been some high-profile female directors such as Kathryn Bigelow and Ava DuVernay, they remain a minority. This paper seeks to examine the representation of female film directors and male directors in Hollywood films from 2014 to 2018. It will look at the number of female and male directors working in the film industry, the gender pay gap in Hollywood, and the barriers faced by female directors in getting their films made. It will also explore how these barriers affect female directors' careers and how they struggle to be taken seriously in a male-dominated industry.

Methodology: This paper will be based on quantitative data collected from various sources, including box office data, film ratings, and reviews. It will also draw on qualitative data from interviews with female directors, as well as experts in the field of gender and media studies.

Results: The results of this paper will show that while there has been an increase in the number of female film directors working in Hollywood, there is still a long way to go before gender parity is achieved. The paper will also show that while there has been some progress in addressing the gender pay gap in Hollywood, it remains a major issue that needs to be addressed urgently. The paper will conclude with recommendations for ways to address these issues and create a more equal environment for female filmmakers in Hollywood.

prompt: ### Human: "Hvað segir Nassim Nicholas Taleb um markaðseffektívnámi?"### Assistant:
system:
Nassim Nicholas Taleb is an author and a former hedge fund manager who is known for his work on the theory of black swan events. He has written several books, including "The Black Swan" and "Antifragile: Things That Gain from Disorder." In his work, he argues that markets are highly unpredictable and that it is impossible to predict the future with any degree of certainty. He also argues that markets are inherently unstable and that they are more likely to exhibit extreme volatility than stability.

Taleb's work has been highly influential in the fields of economics, finance, and risk management. His ideas have been widely discussed and debated in academic circles and have had a significant impact on the way that markets are understood and managed.
source: "Hvað segir Nassim Nicholas Taleb um markaðseffektívnámi?"

prompt: ### Human: Veistu eitthvað um bókina "listin að hugsa skýrt" sem Rolf Dobelli skrifaði?### Assistant:
system:
The book "The Art of Thinking Clearly" by Rolf Dobelli is a collection of essays on the psychology of decision-making, reasoning, and problem-solving. The book aims to help readers make better decisions in their personal and professional lives by highlighting common cognitive biases and logical fallacies that can lead to poor decision-making. Some of the topics covered in the book include:

1. The illusion of understanding: The tendency to overestimate our ability to understand complex systems or problems.

2. Overconfidence: The tendency to overestimate our abilities and underestimate the risks of failure.

3. Availability heuristic: The tendency to make decisions based on the information that is most easily available, rather than the most accurate or relevant information.

4. Sunk cost fallacy: The tendency to continue investing time or money in a decision because we have already invested resources, even when the investment is no longer rational.

5. Base rate neglect: The tendency to ignore the most relevant information in making decisions, such as general trends or patterns that may be more significant than specific data points.

6. Optimism bias: The tendency to overestimate our chances of success and underestimate the risks involved in a decision.

7. Status quo bias: The tendency to stick with a decision or status quo even when it may not be optimal or beneficial.

8. Survivorship bias: The tendency to focus on successful examples or outcomes while ignoring unsuccessful ones, leading to an incomplete understanding of a problem or situation.

9. Confirmation bias: The tendency to seek out information that confirms our existing beliefs or assumptions, while ignoring information that contradicts them.

10. Reaction time bias: The tendency to react more quickly to stimuli that are more emotionally charged, leading to poorer decision-making in high-stakes situations.
source: Veistu eitthvað um bókina "listin að hugsa skýrt" sem Rolf Dobelli skrifaði?

The MEL-spectogram method is based on a mathematical model that takes into account the frequency content of a speech signal, and uses this information to analyze the speech signal. This method produces a graphical representation of the frequency content of the speech signal, which can be used to analyze the speech signal and identify patterns.

The MFCC method, on the other hand, is a simpler method that converts a speech signal into a set of numerical coefficients that represent the frequency content of the speech signal. These coefficients can then be used to analyze the speech signal and identify patterns. The MFCC method is more commonly used than the MEL-spectogram method, as it is easier to implement and requires less computational resources.

system:

The main purpose of Winmx was to allow users to share files with each other, including music, movies, games, and other types of media. It did this by using a peer-to-peer (P2P) file sharing system, which meant that users could connect directly to each other and share files without having to go through a central server.

The Winmx client, or software that users used to access the platform, was called Mcma. This client was designed to be simple and user-friendly, with a clean interface and straightforward navigation.

The Winmx protocol itself is an open source protocol that is based on the BitTorrent file sharing protocol. This means that it uses a decentralized network of users to download and upload files, rather than relying on a central server. This made it difficult for copyright holders to shut down the platform, as there was no central server that they could target.

In addition to its file sharing capabilities, Winmx also had some unique features that set it apart from other P2P platforms at the time. For example, it had built-in chat functionality, allowing users to communicate with each other while they were sharing files. It also had a built-in search engine that allowed users to find specific types of files easily.

Overall, Winmx was a popular P2P platform that provided an easy way for users to share files with each other without having to worry about complicated setup processes or copyright restrictions. The platform's simple interface and easy-to-use features made it accessible to users of all skill levels.

prompt: ### Human: "Hvað eru einstök söluhugsanir (USP) fyrir SaaS könnunartól?"### Assistant:
system:
USP stands for "Unique Selling Proposition," which is a unique selling point that differentiates your SaaS product from others in the market.

The USP for SaaS products typically revolves around the following:

1. Ease of use: A SaaS product with a simple and intuitive interface that requires minimal training for users to get started.
2. Low cost: SaaS products often have lower upfront costs compared to traditional software and require less maintenance and upgrades.
3. Scalability: A SaaS product can be scaled up or down depending on the needs of the business, making it ideal for companies with growing or fluctuating needs.
4. Integration: A SaaS product that integrates seamlessly with other applications and tools, enabling businesses to streamline their workflows and processes.
5. Automation: A SaaS product that automates repetitive tasks and processes, freeing up time for employees to focus on more strategic work.
6. Security: A SaaS product that provides robust security measures to protect sensitive data and prevent data breaches.
7. Data analysis: A SaaS product that provides powerful analytics tools to help businesses make data-driven decisions and optimize their operations.
source: "Hvað eru einstök söluhugsanir (USP) fyrir SaaS könnunartól?"

system:
The book "Fooled by Randomness" by Nassim Nicholas Taleb is a controversial work that has received both praise and criticism. Here are some key points of the book and the main criticisms:

1. Taleb argues that randomness is a more powerful force in our lives than we realize, and that we often make decisions based on false assumptions about the likelihood of certain outcomes. He calls this "skillful luck," or the ability to recognize patterns in random events and make decisions based on them.

1. One of the main criticisms of the book is that it oversimplifies the complexities of human behavior and decision-making. Taleb's ideas about randomness may be true in some cases, but they do not fully explain all human behavior. Additionally, his writing style is often dense and difficult to understand, which can make it challenging for readers to grasp his main points.

2. Another criticism of the book is that Taleb relies heavily on anecdotal evidence to support his arguments, which can make his conclusions seem arbitrary and unsubstantiated. For example, he cites several historical examples of people who were successful despite facing random events, but does not provide any rigorous statistical analysis to back up his claims.

3. Taleb also takes a highly skeptical view of modern society, arguing that it is overly reliant on technology and data analysis, which he sees as oversimplifying complex problems and leading to bad decisions. This position has been criticized as being too pessimistic and misguided, as many experts believe that technology and data analysis can be used effectively to solve problems and improve decision-making processes.

4. Finally, some have argued that Taleb's ideas are more suitable for business executives or investors than for the general public, as they require a high level of understanding of finance and economics. For those without a background in these areas, the book may be difficult to understand or apply to their everyday lives.

In summary, "Fooled by Randomness" has both strengths and weaknesses, but its main criticism is that it oversimplifies complex issues and relies too heavily on anecdotal evidence rather than rigorous analysis. While it may have some value for business executives or investors looking to make better decisions in uncertain environments, it may not be as useful for the general public who do not have a background in finance or economics.

```python

```
2. Using it as a command line argument: In some cases, you may want to pass a value to a function as an argument. For example, if you have a function that takes two arguments, you can use the @ symbol to pass one of those arguments:

```
3. Creating an email address: In Python, the @ symbol is often used to create email addresses. For example, if your email address is "john@example.com", you could write it as follows:
```python
>>> john@example.com # email address without the @ symbol will also work
```
4. Using it as an alias for another command: In some cases, you may want to use the @ symbol as an alias for another command. For example, you could use @echo off in Windows PowerShell to turn off echoing:
```powershell
PS> @echo off # turns off echoing in PowerShell
```
5. As a shortcut for print(): In some cases, you may want to use the @ symbol as a shortcut for print(). For example:
```python
>>> print(@) # prints "Hello, World!" on the console in Python 3.8 and above

prompt: ### Human: "Hvað eru F-merki í kristalfræði? Hvernig eru þau skapað og hvaða afleiðingar hafa þau á almennt útlit kristalsins?"### Assistant:
system:
F-merki (F-marks) in crystallography are the symbols that represent the lattice planes in a crystal structure. Here's how they are created and how they relate to the overall crystal structure:

1. The F-mark is created by combining the Miller indices of the lattice plane with a subscript. For example, (110) is a common F-mark that represents a lattice plane with Miller indices of (1, 1, 0).

2. The F-mark is placed in the unit cell of the crystal structure. The unit cell is the smallest repeating unit of the crystal structure and is used to describe the overall symmetry of the structure.

3. The F-mark indicates the symmetry of the lattice plane relative to the unit cell. For example, (110) has a D2h symmetry, which means that it can be rotated by 360° around two axes and by 180° around one axis. This symmetry can be seen in many crystal structures, such as diamond (A4), graphite (Bm), and sodium chloride (I4/mmm).

4. The F-mark also indicates the orientation of the lattice plane relative to other lattice planes in the unit cell. For example, (110) is always perpendicular to the <100> direction in a cubic crystal structure.

5. The F-marks are used in combination with other symbols, such as c/a (the ratio of a and c lattice constants), to describe specific aspects of a crystal structure. For example, if we have a cubic crystal with c/a = 1 and we want to describe its axis system, we can use F(hkl) notation where F is an F-mark for a particular lattice plane, h is an integer representing its h direction, l is an integer representing its l direction, and k is an integer representing its k direction. In this case, we would write F(hkl) = (110) for the axis system.

6. The F-marks are also used to describe the Bragg diffraction patterns that are observed in X-ray diffraction experiments. The Bragg condition for a given F-mark requires that X-rays with specific wavelengths and angles be directed at a crystal sample to produce characteristic diffraction patterns. This allows us to determine the structure of a crystal based on its Bragg patterns and its corresponding F-marks.

2. Use a content management system (CMS): If you have a website or blog that uses a CMS, such as WordPress or Drupal, you can usually create an RSS feed from within the CMS itself. 3. Use a feed generator: If you want more control over the structure of your RSS feed, you can use a tool like FeedForAll or FeedFlare to create one from scratch. Regardless of which method you choose, the basic steps for creating an RSS feed are as follows:

2. Decide on the frequency of updates: How often do you want your content to be updated in the RSS feed? This could be daily, weekly, or monthly, depending on the type of content and your audience's needs.

1. Install Node.js: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript code outside of a web browser. You can download Node.js from the official website.

2. Install npm: npm is a package manager for Node.js that allows you to install and manage packages of code written in JavaScript. You can download npm from the official website.

3. Clone a repository: Git is a version control system that allows you to store and manage files in a central repository. You can clone a repository by copying the repository's contents onto your computer.

To clone a repository with Typescript and npm and git, you will need to:

1. Open a terminal window or command prompt on your computer, and navigate to the directory where you want to store your project.

2. Run the following command to clone the repository using Git:
```git clone https://github.com/[username]/[repository].git```
Replace [username] with the username of the repository owner, and [repository] with the name of the repository that you want to clone. For example, if you want to clone a repository called "typescript-and-npm-tutorial" from the GitHub account "typescript-and-npm-tutorial", then you would run:
```git clone https://github.com/typescript-and-npm-tutorial/typescript-and-npm-tutorial.git```
3. Once the repository has been cloned, you will see a new directory in your current directory called "typescript-and-npm-tutorial". This is your project directory, and it contains all of the files that make up your project.
4. Open the "package.json" file in your project directory using a text editor such as Notepad or VS Code (if you don't have it installed, you can download it for free from Microsoft). The "package.json" file is where you define all of the dependencies for your project, such as Typescript and npm itself.
5. Copy and paste the following code into the "package.json" file:
```{
  "name": "typescript-and-npm-tutorial",
  "version": "1",
  "description": "A tutorial project demonstrating how to use Typescript and npm",
  "main": "index.js",

  "dependencies": {
    "@types/node": "^16.9.0",

  }
} ```Save this file and close it without making any changes to it since we will be making changes to it later on in this tutorial by adding additional packages through npm commands such as `npm install` or `npm install @types/express`.

Við erum viku inn í ferðinni og þetta er þögnust sem ég hef nokkru sinni verið þegar ég er með annan einstakling, þar sem hann hunsar allar tilraunir mínar til samræðu. Hann notast við airpods-ina sína í bílnum og um húsnæðið - ekki að ég hafi haldið áfram að reyna að tala við hann. Í alvöru, hann er að draga alvarlega slæma orku með sér í allt og það er að eyða ferðinni minni.
Við höfum ennþá ekki bókað neitt á Suðureyjuna, svo ég er að plana að sleppa honum í Wellington við ferjuna. Líklegast bóka eigin bíl í Picton og bara slaka á einn á endanum. (Það er svo mikillega léttandi að hugsa um það að það gerir mig tilfinningalegan. Ég mun borga hvaða verð sem er bara til að komast í burtu frá honum.)
Auðvitað er það ekki besta leiðin að segja honum að hann sé að eyða ferðinni minni með neikvæðri orku sinni.
Einhver ráð fyrir besta leiðina til að skipta á vinsælum háttum? Eða að minnsta kosti ekki hafa deilu sem endar með mjög sárum tilfinningum?

Sure, here's a brief description of GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows:

GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows are automated processes that run on GitHub's continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) platform. They are defined in YAML files and run on a schedule or whenever a certain event occurs, such as a pull request or push to a branch.

GitHub Actions allow users to set up automated builds, tests, and deployments for their projects, making it easier to integrate code changes with the rest of their workflow.

One common use case for GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows is for Continuous Integration (CI), which involves automatically building and testing code changes as they are merged into the main branch. This helps to catch any errors or issues early in the development process, before they can cause more significant problems.

For Continuous Delivery (CD), GitHub Actions can automatically deploy code changes to production environments once they have been approved by the development team. This helps to reduce the time and effort required to deploy code changes, allowing developers to focus on writing code rather than managing deployment processes.

Here's an example of a GitHub Actions CI/CD workflow that uses the "workflow_dispatch" event to trigger the execution of a build pipeline:
```yaml
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout Codebase
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Run Build Pipeline
        uses: ${{ runner.executor }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/build-pipeline-runner@v1  # TODO: Replace with your GitHub Action name and version information here.
        with:  # Specify parameters for your build pipeline here. See documentation for more details.
          workflow_dispatch: true   # Trigger the build pipeline upon execution of this job. See documentation for more details.  # TODO: Replace with your workflow ID here.  # TODO: Replace with your parameters here if needed.  # TODO: Replace with your authentication token here if needed.   # Note that the values in this example will need to be replaced with actual values from your project configuration.

Allt verður bara smátt barnalegt og tilbúið þegar sögunni tapar tengingu við grundvallarefni sín og reiðin gegn kerfinu tekur yfir. Ég hef mikinn virðingu fyrir því hvernig þessi mynd var gerð, en eins og Matrix finnst mér að fólk tengi miklu meira mikilvægi við þessa mynd en hún á skilið.

Umsögn 3: Þrátt fyrir góða þemu, frábær leiklist og mikilvægar skilaboð sem þessi mynd flytir á óhefðbundinn hátt, tel ég að hún missi tengingu við áhorfandann og láti hann eftir í heimi áhugaleysis. Þótt meirihluti umsagna finni þessa mynd skemmtilega og áhugaverða, þá væri ég í minnihluta sem tel að þessi mynd sé mjög yfirvöðuð.
Umsögn 4: Er að stofna óreglu, sprengingum og meðlimastöðu í herská hættulegur leið til að losna við efnafjötra?! Sjónræn áhrif eru heillaandi og söguþráðurinn er áhugaverður fram að miðjum. Því miður endar það ekki vel.

Þú andvarpar með ánægju. Svo gott að hafa skýra leið fram á. Að vera ekki lengur í óvissu.
Nú ertu að fara fram á fullur af orku, tilbúinn að forrita lausnina þína.
En þá, skyndilega, kastar viðmælandinn þér kúlubolti.
"Hvað ef við hugsum um vandamálið á þennan hátt?"
Þú finnur spennu sem við höfum öll upplifað í forritunarsamtölunum:
"Reyndu að hlusta á það sem þeir segja...en tapaðu ekki því sem þú varst að hugsa...uff, ég get ekki gert bæði!"

Töfla: Address

The results showed that blue light exposure at night increased the risk of cardiovascular disease and premature death, while red light exposure was associated with lower insulin resistance, which may contribute to a lower risk of type 2 diabetes.

The study found that reducing blue light exposure at night may be an effective strategy to reduce the risk of future heart disease and premature death. However, more research is needed to understand the exact role of red light exposure in promoting insulin sensitivity and preventing type 2 diabetes.

Tilraunir á tveimur vélþýðingaverkefnum sýna að þessi módell eru yfirburða í gæðum en eru einnig meira samhæfanleg og krefjast marktæks minni tíma til þjálfunar. Módelið okkar náði 28,4 BLEU á WMT 2014 enska-íþýska þýðingaverkefninu, sem er betra en bestu niðurstöðurnar sem voru til, þar á meðal samsett módel, um meira en 2 BLEU. Á WMT 2014 enska-franska þýðingaverkefninu náði módelið okkar nýju einstaka módelið besta BLEU einkunnar af 41,8 eftir þjálfun í 3,5 daga átta GPU, sem er lítið brot af þjálfunarkostnaði bestu módelanna úr bókasöfnunni. Við sýnum að Transformer gildir vel fyrir önnur verkefni með því að nota það með góðum árangri við enska setningarþáttun bæði með mikið og takmörkuð þjálfunargögn. 
Útskýrðu: Ríkjandi röðunarmódelin### Assistant:
system:
Here is an English translation of your message:

Title: A new transformer architecture for language translation

Abstract: Large-scale pre-trained language models such as BERT are based on parallel corpora. However, parallel corpora are hard to obtain for some languages and limited in size. We propose a new transformer architecture which leverages monolingual data and does not rely on parallel data. This architecture has a shared token embedding which maps tokens to a vector space. The decoder generates a sequence of vectors, where each vector corresponds to the output token. The generator generates a sequence of vectors which is then mapped back to the output tokens using the shared token embedding.

We present Transformer, a new transformer architecture that leverages monolingual data and does not rely on parallel data. The architecture consists of a single decoder and a single generator which share a shared token embedding. The decoder generates a sequence of vectors, where each vector corresponds to the output token. The generator generates a sequence of vectors which is then mapped back to the output tokens using the shared token embedding. We evaluate Transformer on WMT 2014 English-German translation task and WMT 2014 English-French translation task. On WMT 2014 English-German translation task, Transformer achieves 28.4 BLEU, which is better than state-of-the-art models and outperforms all previous models by more than 2 BLEU. On WMT 2014 English-French translation task, Transformer achieves a new state-of-the-art result of 41.8 BLEU, beating all previous models by more than 1 BLEU and doing so in only 3.5 days using eight GPUs. Transformer is also able to achieve better results than other models with different training settings on English data and outperforming the state-of-the-art model by more than one BLEU score when trained on both English and French data in only 3 days using eight GPUs. Transformer is able to generate high quality translations with limited parallel data, making it a promising approach for language translation without relying on parallel corpora.

Tvö stór svefnpottar eru á þessum hæðum og eru aftan. Bæði með stórum fataskápum og útgöngu út í garðinn. Stílhreinum endurnýjaður fullur baðherbergi á þessum hæðum.

Ólíkulega djúpur garður er fallega skreyttur og skiptur í þrepum. Tvottaherbergi/geymslur, einbílastæði í geymslu, Tesla sólarsellur. Frábær staðsetning í flótnum hluta Noe Valley - skammtíma göngufjarlægđ frá öllu því sem Noe hefur að bjóða. Skref frá J-Church og þægindi flugvallarflutninga/vegakerfa.

Þriðji svefnpottur/annar fullur baðherbergi er staðsettur á jarðhæð - fullkominn sem gestaherbergi, heimilisstofu, hreyfingarsvæði o.fl. To set up a geolocation map in Google Sheets using a formula, you can use the following steps:

1. In Google Sheets, open a new blank spreadsheet and create a new sheet.

2. In the first column, enter the column headings "Country", "Latitude", and "Longitude".

3. In the second column, enter the formula =TEXT(C7,"US") to set the country to "U.S.A." for each row where the value in cell C7 is equal to "U.S.A.", or use a similar formula to set the country for each row where the value in cell C7 is equal to "Canada" or "Europe" or "America".

4. In the third column, enter the formula =QUERY(GEOCODE(A2:A,"country"),"geodata") to get the latitude and longitude values for each row. You can replace "A2:A" with the range of cells you want to geolocate, and you can also use other countries or regions instead of "country".

5. In the fourth column, enter the formula =MATCH(C7,D:D) to find the index of each row in column C, so you can add it to column E to calculate the distance between each row's latitude and longitude values and your current location. You can replace "D:D" with a different range of cells if you want to use different distance formulas instead of Euclidean distance (E6).

6. In column E, enter one of these formulas based on your location:
    - Euclidean Distance: =E6*298.2572 - 30089468011947000000000000000 - 159365594533853414349738844277 - DIST(E6,E2)
    - Great Circle Distance: =ROUND((E6*298.2572 - 3008946801194700000000000)*COS(RADIANS(D2)) * 111319.899)
    - Haversine Distance: =ACOS((SQRT(POWER((E6-E2),2) + POWER((C7-D2),2))) * 111319.899)

This will create a map of your data showing distances between rows and your current location.

NBS can be used to address a variety of societal challenges, including climate change, biodiversity loss, water scarcity, and flooding. They can also be used to enhance ecosystem services, such as pollination, water filtration, and carbon sequestration.

NBS can contribute to sustainability in a variety of ways. For example, they can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions by sequestering carbon in soils and vegetation. They can also help mitigate the effects of climate change by providing natural buffers against extreme weather events. Additionally, NBS can help conserve biodiversity by restoring natural habitats and protecting endangered species.

NBS can also contribute to resilience by providing multiple benefits for society. For example, they can help reduce the impacts of extreme weather events by mitigating flooding or providing natural buffers against storm surges. They can also help reduce the risk of wildfires by maintaining healthy vegetation and reducing fuel loads.

This includes understanding how NBS can contribute to sustainability and resilience in different contexts, such as urban areas or rural landscapes. It also requires engaging stakeholders across different sectors and levels of governance to ensure that NBS are implemented in a way that meets the needs of society while protecting the natural environment. 

In conclusion, NBS have the potential to contribute significantly to sustainability and resilience by providing multiple benefits for society while conserving natural ecosystems. By taking a holistic approach and engaging stakeholders across different sectors, we can ensure that NBS are implemented in a way that meets the needs of society while protecting the natural environment for future generations."

prompt: ### Human: "Hvað ef Aztekar hefðu tekist vel fyrir Spánverjum sem herjuðu á þeim?"### Assistant:

The Aztecs were known for their advanced agricultural practices, their complex social and political systems, and their rich cultural traditions. However, they are also known for their role in the Spanish conquest of Mexico, which began in 1519 and culminated in the fall of the Aztec empire in 1521.

The Aztecs were conquered by a Spanish army led by Hernán Cortés, who landed on the coast of Mexico with a small force of soldiers and sailors. Cortés and his men were able to defeat the Aztec emperor, Moctezuma II, and capture the Aztec capital city of Tenochtitlan. The Spanish used military force and political manipulation to conquer the Aztec empire and bring it under Spanish rule.

The Spanish conquest of Mexico had far-reaching consequences for the Aztecs and other indigenous peoples of Central America. The conquest led to the spread of European diseases, such as smallpox and measles, which devastated indigenous populations. It also led to the disruption of indigenous cultural practices, as well as the forced conversion of indigenous people to Christianity.

Despite these negative impacts, some scholars have argued that the Spanish conquest also had positive effects on the Aztecs and other indigenous peoples of Central America. For example, the conquest led to the introduction of European technology and knowledge, which helped to modernize indigenous societies. Additionally, some scholars argue that the conquest led to greater political stability in Central America, as it replaced fragmented and warring indigenous kingdoms with a unified Spanish colonial administration.

Overall, the Spanish conquest of Mexico had both positive and negative impacts on the Aztecs and other indigenous peoples of Central America. While it led to the destruction of indigenous cultural practices and the spread of European diseases, it also brought about positive changes such as the introduction of new technologies and greater political stability.

from email.mime.text import MIMEText

server = smtplib.SMTP('smtp.gmail.com', 587)
server.starttls() # Enable SSL encryption
server.login("YOUR_EMAIL_ADDRESS", "YOUR_PASSWORD")
server.set_debuglevel(1) # This will show debug information to the console, which may be helpful if you are troubleshooting an issue
fromaddr = "YOUR_EMAIL_ADDRESS"
toaddr = "TO@ADDRESS"
msg = MIMEText("This is the subject line.\nThis is the body text.")

msg["To"] = toaddr
server.sendmail(fromaddr, toaddr, msg.as_string()) # Send the message to the recipient
server.quit() # Close the connection to the server

prompt: ### Human: Skrifaðu umsögn um tónleika með symphony, þar sem þú fjallar um framkomu hljómsveitarinnar og almennt upplifunina hjá áheyrendum.### Assistant:

Icelandic symphonies are a unique and captivating art form that has been shaped by the country's rich cultural heritage and musical traditions. Icelandic symphonies often feature a blend of traditional Icelandic music and classical western music, creating a unique and mesmerizing sound that is distinctively Icelandic.

One of the most notable Icelandic symphonies is the "Symphony No. 3" by Daníel Bjarnason, which was commissioned by the Iceland Symphony Orchestra in 2007. The piece was inspired by the landscape and culture of Iceland, and features a blend of traditional Icelandic music and modern classical music. The work was received with critical acclaim and has become one of the most popular works by an Icelandic composer.

Another famous Icelandic symphony is "Symphony No. 2" by Anna Thorvaldsdóttir, which was commissioned by the Royal Scottish National Orchestra in 2013. The piece is a large-scale work that explores the concept of time and memory, and features a blend of traditional Icelandic music and modern classical music. The work has been praised for its innovative approach to orchestration and its emotional impact on audiences.

Icelandic symphonies also often feature a strong emphasis on melody and harmony, with many works drawing inspiration from the country's unique landscape and natural beauty. This emphasis on melody and harmony creates a sense of peace and tranquility that is unique to Icelandic symphonies, making them an ideal choice for those looking for a calming and relaxing listening experience.

In addition to their emotional impact, many Icelandic symphonies also feature advanced orchestration techniques that showcase the country's rich musical tradition. For example, "Symphony No. 1" by Hildur Guðnadóttir features a blend of traditional Icelandic music with modern classical music, while "Symphony No. 4" by Bára Gísladóttir features a blend of traditional Icelandic music with jazz and rock influences.

Overall, Icelandic symphonies are a unique art form that showcase the country's rich musical traditions and cultural heritage. With their emotional impact, advanced orchestration techniques, and emphasis on melody and harmony, they are sure to captivate audiences for years to come.
